sanskrit_verse:
पाणिग्रहणिका मन्त्रा नियतं दारलक्षणम् ।
तेषां निष्ठा तु विज्ञेया विद्वद्भिः सप्तमे पदे ॥ ८.२२७॥
transliteration:
pāṇigrahaṇikā mantra niyataṁ dāralakṣaṇam |
teṣāṁ niṣṭhā tu vijñeyā vidvadbhiḥ saptame padae || 8.227||
sph_interpretive_translation: The mantras recited during the act of holding hands are deterministically indicative of conjugal union; their steadfast adherence is to be known by the learned in the seventh stage.
jurisprudential_principles: Authority resides in conscious alignment with ritualized intent
Causation flows through consecrated ceremonial acts
Capacity-based responsibility is determined by spiritual maturity
Restoration logic operates via completion of sacramental sequence
Consciousness alignment manifests through disciplined repetition
executable_legal_axioms: IF conjugal status is disputed THEN verify presence and accuracy of pāṇigrahaṇa mantras
IF mantra omission detected THEN initiate guided re-enactment protocol under qualified supervision
IF deliberate deviation observed THEN assess actor's capacity through saptama pada alignment metrics
IF valid completion confirmed THEN register union as fully restored within societal matrix
IF unresolved THEN escalate to vidvad council for consciousness-readjustment process
supreme_court_application: In Supreme Court adjudication, this verse establishes that marital validity hinges upon precise execution of foundational rites. The threshold of responsibility lies not in punitive fault assignment but in verifying whether the actors have accessed the requisite level of awareness (sapta pada). Authority derives from alignment with the consecrated form, not personal interpretation.
nyaya_and_non_punitive_alignment: Pramāṇa-based causality confirms that the utterance of specific mantras at the time of hand-holding creates a binding energetic configuration. Anupūrvaśaḥ ensures sequential unfolding: physical gesture → verbal invocation → metaphysical union. Responsibility is proportional to one’s access to sapta pada—spiritual insight—not external coercion. This framework upholds reality as non-punitive because misalignment triggers correction, not condemnation.
